intro: Paschanthus repandus, commonly known as the broadleaf paschanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Passifloraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of vibrant, showy flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Paschanthus repandus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display.
